question.theQuestion: (97) A(n) _____ is a computer program designed to fetch and display Web pages on the Internet.
(81) _____ refers to the amount of room available in a computer for adding more memory or peripheral devices.
(98) _____ is how closely measurements cluster around the median or mean.
(54) A(n) _____ is any unwanted change of shape of a signal.
(70) A device which displays the computer output is called a _____.
(60) A _____ is a device which divides a signal into two or more outputs while maintaining a degree of isolation between the outputs.
(58) Electromagnetic _____ refers to the production of an electric field in a conductor whenever magnetic lines of force move across it.
(94) A physical layout of a LAN where all nodes are connected to a single cable is called _____ topology.
(96) _____ LAN is a type of LAN in which all the microcomputers on the network communicate directly with one another without relying on a server.
(89) A(n) _____ is a hardware and software combination used to connect the same types of network.
(79) The process offinding any fault in a program is called _____.
(13) Sampling is a method of measuring the magnitude of a(n) _____ signal at different points of time to enable it to be converted into an equivalent digital signal.
(52) _____ is the basic unit of frequency.
(24) One of two possible conditions a logical quantity may have, represented numerically as :'0' or '1' and electrically as 'low' or 'high' voltage levels is called _____.
(43) The electromagnetic _____ of a circuit is related to the extent to which a circuit is sensitive to such disturbances.
(72) _____ is/are used to hold data and instructions that will be used shortly by the CPU.
(46) A(n) _____ is a type of filter configuration in which the impedance elements are arranged in a bridge network.
(83) An extra bit attached to the end of a byte which enables a computer system to check for errors during transmission is called a _____ bit.
(14) A circuit for adding a dc component to an ac signal (also known as a dc restorer) is called a _____.
(80) _____ is the process of finding electrical or mechanical faults in a microcomputer system.
(76) _____ refers to the organizational structure or hardware configuration of a computer.
(84) A _____ is a circuit between two other circuits that serves to isolate them under certain conditions or to connect them under other conditions.
(19) A digital circuit is _____ when it does not respond to inputs in accordance with its design.
(8) A loudspeaker is a transducer that converts electrical signals into _____.
(12) An ADC (Analogue Digital Converter) is an electronic circuit which changes analogue _____ into digital.
(71) In the binary system, each 0(off) or 1(on) is called a _____
(36) Any device that produces electrical energy is called a _____.
(99) _____ is the difference between the actual measurement and the mean.
(66) A _____ is the main circuit board in the system unit of a microcomputer.
(88) A set of rules that must be observed in order for two electronic devices to communicate with each other is called a _____.
(31) A _____ is any undesired current flow in certain components such as semiconductors and capacitors.
(26) The borderline between a valid logic-state voltage and a transition zone is called a(n) _____.
(38) A _____ is a source of direct current or voltage that consists of two or more electrolytic cells connected together and used as a single unit.
(44) Interference enters a system either by _____ or radiation.
(6) _____ take an electrical input signal and produce a corresponding variation in a physical quantity.
